intro: Pleurandropsis phebalioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pleurandropsis, is a rare and enigmatic member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, particularly in South Africa and Lesotho. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is often found in rocky outcrops or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying rare and endemic flora.
